summary: A mod that allows you to play Minecraft from within Skyrim.
descriptionHtml:
[center][youtube]l2LmOf9kJD8[/youtube][/center]

[size=7][b][u]That's right, ladies and gentlemen, it's finally here![/u][/b][/size]

[size=4]Minecraft.[/size] [size=5]In.[/size] [size=6]Skyrim![/size] [size=1](Not to be confused with [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=80592162&searchtext=minecraft]Minecraft in Skyrim[/url], which is completely different and has no legal affiliation with Minecraft mod for Skyrim or its creator)[/size]

This mod adds the ability to play (a rudimentary version of) Minecraft from within Skyrim by traveling a short distance away from Riverwood and finding a Strange Cube.

[size=4][b]Warning: This is a novelty mod, and as such is not meant to be used on personal saves. If you do decide to use it on a save you use to play the game regularly, I would highly recommend making a backup of it, just in case![/b][/size]

Currently in version 1.0, there are stone, cobblestone, wood, log, dirt, grass, leaf, and sapling blocks, as well as a static chest and workbench. Craftable tools are wooden axes, pickaxes, and shovels. The mod includes three downloads corresponding to different world sizes (Large worlds may lag your computer!).

[size=4][b][u]Known issues (Bugs that cannot be fixed, as far as I know):[/u][/b][/size]
• You cannot place blocks while jumping.
• Your tool reach is significantly smaller than in the actual Minecraft game.
• Attempting to place blocks while pointing near the edge of a block face will sometimes fail to place the block or place it on the wrong side.

[size=4][b][u]Known long-term bugs (Bugs that can potentially be fixed, but I'm not entirely certain how to do it yet):[/u][/b][/size]
• Trees can grow inside other blocks.
• Grass does not spread.
• The tools have no inner-face (If someone would mind modeling the tools and giving me the .nif files, I'd be greatly obliged. The way that I export models from Blender messes up the UVs, and I have to fix them by had, which just isn't something I can do on a model that complex).

[size=4][b][u]Known short-term bugs (Bugs that can likely be fixed within the next update):[/u][/b][/size]
• Bedrock has no texture.
author: ChronusZ
